intro: Eriotheca surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam trumpet tree, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has palmate leaves and produces showy, fragrant blooms that are typically pink or red. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is found in humid, tropical environments. The tree also has a fibrous bark that has been used in traditional medicine.
